722568f-b.title: Manhattan: Pike Slip - South Street
722568f-b.text:
(1)
Pike S44D:, east side, north from South Street, to and including Cherry Street. Also shown is Pike Street, (a continuation of Pile Slip, north of Cherry Street,i north from and including Cherry, to and including Division Streets. The view shows on the left,
the Manhattan Bridge Anchorage.
July 25, 1931.
P. Ls Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
July 25, 1931.
E. L. Sperr.

723329f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Pike Slip
723329f-a.text:
South Street, west from (No. 236), but not including Pike Slip, showing prominently (white structure), the Hearst Publications Building extending from Market to Catherine Slips, and (left), the fronts of Piers 31, 3O and 29, East River. Also shown (background), is a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge and (left to right), The Farmer's Loan and Trust Co. Building, the 60 Wall Street Tower (under construction), and the Bank of Manhattan Co. Building.
July 25, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
723329f-a.folder: South Street & Pike Slip, Manhattan, NY

house) also bears No. 89 Pike Slip.
July 25, 1931.
P. L. SPerr.
The same, showing only Nos. 241 and 242. Note the farther view on
Pike Slip to Cherry Street.
Jwly 2S, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

723330f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Pike Slip.
723330f-a.text:
South Street, south side, at the foot of Pike Slip, showing oyster barges under the Manhattan Bridge. These floating structures are on the East River waterfront.
April 1, 1937
Berenice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project
